intro: Eleutheranthera ruderalis, commonly known as the rough bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, thriving in ruderal environments. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its adaptability, it is often considered a weed in agricultural areas.
